bwwExcerpt: A hit across the world but criminally absent from New York for four years, a new production, with original clown Arnie Burton along for the ride, opened Monday at the Union Square Theater with good cheer and manic energy...the evening belongs to Burton and fellow clown Billy Carter, who each tackle 50 or so characters, from cackling salesmen of ladies' underwear to assorted police officers to various women to inanimate objects including rocks. They're part Marx brothers and part Monty Python...D
